entry.title: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales orders
entry.content:
Hi,

The company is in japan , the tax rate for domestic sales orders in Japan is 10% .

Meanwhile, the Japanese yen currency does not have a decimal point.

For example, when we create a sales order with a net value of 115 and the system calculates a sales tax of 12, but the actual tax amount is 11, how can we adjust the tax amount?

entry.title: Re: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales orders
entry.content: Check the Rounding Rule setting. Change it to "D" (round down) or equivalent to truncate fractions. If "D" is not available, use "X" but with a custom routine or check for Japan-specific settings.

entry.title: Re: Upcoming Deprecation of VBScript, its Impact on SAP GUI Scripting and Resulting Strategy
entry.content:
Hello @Torsten_Hambsch,

here a working example:

# Begin-----------------------------------------------------------------

."$PSScriptRoot\COM.ps1"

Function Main {

  $SapGuiAuto = Get-Object( , "SAPGUI")
  If ($SapGuiAuto -isnot [System.__ComObject]) {
    Return
  }

  $application = Invoke-Method $SapGuiAuto "GetScriptingEngine"
  If ($application -isnot [System.__ComObject]) {
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  Set-Property -object $application -propertyName "HistoryEnabled" `
    -propertyValue $False
  $connection = Get-Property $application "Children" @(0)
  If ($connection -eq $Null) {
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  $DisabledByServer = Get-Property $connection "DisabledByServer"
  If ($True -eq $DisabledByServer) {
    Return
  }

  $session = Get-Property $connection "Children" @(0)
  If ($session -eq $Null) {
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  $Busy = Get-Property $session "Busy"
  If ($True -eq $Busy) {
    Free-Object -object $session
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return;
  }

  $Info = Get-Property $session "Info"
  $IsLowSpeedConnection = Get-Property $Info "IsLowSpeedConnection"
  If ($True -eq $IsLowSpeedConnection) {
    Free-Object -object $session
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }



  Set-Property -object $application -propertyName "HistoryEnabled" `
    -propertyValue @($True)
  Free-Object -object $session
  Free-Object -object $connection
  Free-Object -object $application
  Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto

}

# Main
Main

# End-------------------------------------------------------------------

I tried it on Windows 11 with SAP GUI 8.00 PL 14 and PowerShell Windows 5.1 (all x64) and it works as expected.

The MSScriptControl is only available on x86, so it can't work with x64. I don't recommend anyone to work with that anymore, it's extremely outdated and deprecated.

I don't have the slightest idea why it doesn't work for you. Try the example above.

Best regards
Stefan

entry.title: What's New for Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-2508
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Here is a blog post of What's New features introduced in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 edition in the exciting world of SAP Joule.

New use cases now supported

Joule now enables you to view business data of many SAP objects like Process order , Solution order, Enterprise project , Inspection methods , Work Centers and many more...

Update Delivery Date for Purchase Orders

Joule enables you, as a purchaser, to update delivery dates for purchase orders.

For example, when suppliers or equivalent sources inform you of delays or changes, you can use Joule to update the delivery dates with the new information.

Checking sales order fulfillment status

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

Expiring Prices Handling

Joule now enables you to manage expiring prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. With Joule, you can fetch prices that will expire soon, extend their valid-to dates, and adjust their condition amounts or ratios as you need.

Electronic Document Error Explanations

The Manage Electronic Documents app now enables natural language interaction with Joule, making it easier to understand electronic document exchange errors. You can ask Joule for error explanations and recommended resolution steps. By providing detailed insights, SAP Joule helps you understand the root cause of errors and offers guidance on corrective actions.

There are many more features which can be explored by clicking on the What's New Viewer link https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/capabilities-guide/what-s-new-for-joule-capabilities

Thanks!!!

Explore the SAP Business AI features with SAP Joule.

Regards

Shubham

Joule SAP Business AI SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: Self Service Procure cookbook doesn't describe how th...
entry.content:
Hi @Robson1 

Thank you for your question.

To make the Employee Catalog visible in your My Purchase Requisitions New app within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you must assign several organizations and you muse ensure user roles are configured. This is a common challenge and relates largely to catalog assignment, user default settings and organizational structure.

Here are steps you should take to achieve Employee Catalog visibility

  1. First thing is to use the Default Settings for User Procurement Fiori app to assign catalogs to your user account. When you have properly assigned it, the catalog becomes visible in the Purchase Requisition app for the user.
  2. Ensure the employee is correctly set up in the organization via TCodes PA30 and PPOMA, or the equivalent public cloud apps. Ensure you assign the correct attributes such as CATALOG at the org unit or position, which should flow to the user’s default catalog assignment. Make sure you confirm that data correctly propagates into the table USER_CATALOGS, this mapping is crucial for your catalog visibility.
  3. The user must have the correct business roles assigned such as Employee Procurement and related catalog access. In some cases, missing authorizations or catalog assignments in business roles can prevent catalogs from displaying for the user.
  4. Make sure the catalog definition for Employee Catalog is active and included in the necessary scope items for example, 18J Self-Service Procurement. Please note that internal or external Catalogs must be enabled or configured either through customizing or via business configuration in the cloud.

If after doing that, the catalogs still do not appear, here are steps to troubleshoot the error

  • Ensure you manually update the USER_CATALOGS table via support tools or check if the attribute propagation from PPOMA or your org structure is correct.
  • Sometimes the catalog visibility issues you experience are caused by missing default settings or propagation glitches in organizational setup. So, double check your configuration and security/authorization assignments.

The Employee Catalog should show in your requisition app once these assignments and settings are correctly completed.

Here are some references to provide further details.

My Purchase Requisitions

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library


I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Learning Conferences: Ein umfassender Überblick und Highlights 2025
entry.content:
SAP Learning Conferences bieten eine hervorragende Plattform, um die neuesten SAP-Themen zu erkunden, Einblicke von Branchenexperten zu gewinnen und sich mit Fachkollegen zu vernetzen. 

Wichtige Highlights der SAP Learning Conferences 2025

Teilnehmer können durch den Besuch dieser Veranstaltungen Ihr SAP Wissen gezielt erweitern. Zusätzlich können Teilnehmer 25% auf ihre nächste SAP-Zertifizierung sparen, indem sie sich für eine SAP Learning Conference registrieren.*

Hinweis: Dies ist ein zeitlich begrenztes Angebot und ein aktueller ÜBerblick. Eine frühzeitige Anmeldung wird empfohlen, um Ihren Platz zu sichern.

SAP Security Forum / Deutsche Ausgabe

Mit zunehmenden regulatorischen Anforderungen und dem Bedarf, geschäftskritische SaaS-Plattformen abzusichern, stehen IT-Sicherheitsteams vor erheblichen Herausforderungen. Doch welche Schlüsselthemen müssen Unternehmen angehen, um die SAP-Sicherheit in der Zukunft zu gewährleisten? 

Dieses Forum bietet die Möglichkeit, Ihr Fachwissen im Bereich SAP-Sicherheit durch praxisnahe Präsentationen zu Themen wie:
• IT-Cybersicherheitstrends
• Infrastruktur- und Kommunikationssicherheit
• Identitäts- und Zugriffsmanagement
• Compliance und Datenschutz

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 26.–27. November 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Security Forum / German Edition hier buchen

SAP Integration Suite Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Die SAP Integration Suite ist eine Integration-Platform-as-a-Service (iPaaS), die entwickelt wurde, um die Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Prozessen, Diensten, Anwendungen, Events und Daten zu optimieren.

Bei diesem Forum werden die Teilnehmer:
• Die wichtigsten Funktionen und praktischen Anwendungsfälle der SAP Integration Suite erkunden.
• Über die nahtlose Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Anwendungen mit SAP-Tools und vorkonfigurierten Inhalten lernen.

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 15.–16. Oktober 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Integration Suite Forum hier buchen 

SAP Data and Analytics Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Dieses Forum bietet Einblicke in die neuesten Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich SAP Data and Analytics. Teilnehmer können ihr Wissen durch Expertensitzungen vertiefen und von Erfolgsgeschichten der Kunden lernen. Der erste Tag des Forums ist kostenlos und virtuell, der zweite ist kostenpflichtig und hybrid.

Veranstaltungsstruktur:

Tag 1 (Kostenlos):
Erkunden Sie die neuesten Trends und Entwicklungen in Data and Analytics, einschließlich Best Practices, neuer Technologien und Anwendungen im Zusammenhang mit der SAP Business Data Cloud. Buchen Sie hier die kostenlose Veranstaltung WDVDAF

Tag 2 (Kostenpflichtig):
Nehmen Sie an Expertensitzungen teil, um Ihr Verständnis von SAP Data and Analytics zu verbessern. Tauschen Sie sich mit SAP-Experten, Trainern und anderen Teilnehmern aus. Buchen Sie hier die Veranstaltung in Walldorf ODER virtuell (WDCDAF)

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum:
o 18. November 2025 (Kostenloser virtueller erster Tag)
o 18.–19. November 2025 (Hybridformat, zweiter Tag kostenpflichtig)

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, 18.-19. November 2025 (2 Tage, hybride Durchführung, der zweite Tag ist kostenpflichtig)

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel 1.1.2026 | SAP Training

Diese Veranstaltung bietet einen Überblick über die gesetzlichen Änderungen, die ab dem 1. Januar 2026 die Lohn- und Gehaltsabrechnung in Deutschland betreffen. Die Teilnehmer erfahren mehr über die Reformen, neuen Vorschriften und deren Auswirkungen auf die Abrechnungsprozesse.

Für wen ist diese Veranstaltung geeignet:
• Projektteammitglieder
• Mitarbeiter in der Lohnbuchhaltung
• Erfahrene Berater

Veranstaltungsdetails:
Teilnehmer können zwischen zwei identischen Terminen wählen:
• Präsenzveranstaltung: Donnerstag, 4. Dezember 2025, in St. Leon-Rot
• Virtuelle Veranstaltung: Dienstag, 9. Dezember 2025

Hinweis: Diese Veranstaltung ist nicht für den 25% SAP-Zertifizierungsrabatt qualifiziert.

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel hier buchen

Zusätzliche Hinweise

Hi,
I follow this developer tutorial: "Generate Metrics and Compare Models in SAP AI Core".
(https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/ai-core-metrics.html)

The code has been adjusted following the instructiond of the tutorial and the respective Configuration is Completing an Execution and generating a Model. But in the Execution the Metric Resource remains empty Metrics, Custom Metrics and Tags won't get listed but the Execution runs successful trough...

Has someone an idea what could be the root cause why the following code snipets in my main.py won't work?

 

 

import os
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.model_selection import KFold, train_test_split
from sklearn.inspection import permutation_importance
from datetime import datetime
import pandas as pd
from ai_core_sdk.models import Metric, MetricTag, MetricCustomInfo, MetricLabel
#
# Logging Metrics: SAP AI Core connection (Step 2)
from ai_core_sdk.tracking import Tracking
aic_connection = Tracking()

# Variables
DATA_PATH = '/app/data/train.csv'
DT_MAX_DEPTH = int(os.getenv('DT_MAX_DEPTH'))
MODEL_PATH = '/app/model/model.pkl'
#
# Load Datasets
df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)
X = df.drop('target', axis=1)
y = df['target']
#
# Metric Logging: Basic (Step 3)
# from ai_core_sdk.models import Metric
aic_connection.log_metrics(
    metrics = [
        Metric(
            name= "N_observations", 
            value= float(df.shape[0]), 
            timestamp=datetime.now().utcnow())
    ]
)
#
# Partition into Train and test dataset
train_x, test_x, train_y, test_y = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3)
#
# K-fold
kf = KFold(n_splits=5, random_state=31, shuffle=True)
i = 0 # storing step count
for train_index, val_index in kf.split(train_x):
    i += 1
    # Train model on subset
    clf = DecisionTreeRegressor(max_depth=DT_MAX_DEPTH, random_state=31)
    clf.fit(train_x.iloc[train_index], train_y.iloc[train_index])
    # Score on validation data (hold-out dataset)
    val_step_r2 = clf.score(train_x.iloc[val_index], train_y.iloc[val_index])
    # Metric Logging: Step Information (Step 4)
    aic_connection.log_metrics(
        metrics = [
            Metric(name= "(Val) Fold R2", value= float(val_step_r2), timestamp=datetime.utcnow(), step=i),
        ]
    )
    # Delete step model
    del(clf)
#
# Final Model
clf = DecisionTreeRegressor(max_depth=DT_MAX_DEPTH, random_state=31)
clf.fit(train_x, train_y)
# Scoring over test data
test_r2_score = clf.score(test_x, test_y)
# Metric Logging: Attaching to metrics to generated model (Step 5)
aic_connection.log_metrics(
    metrics = [
        Metric(
            name= "Test data R2",
            value= float(test_r2_score),
            timestamp=datetime.now().utcnow(),
            labels= [
                MetricLabel(name="metrics.ai.sap.com/Artifact.name", value="housemodel")
            ]
        )
    ]
)
#
# Model Explaination
r = permutation_importance(
    clf, test_x, test_y,
    n_repeats=30,
    random_state=0
)
# Feature importances
feature_importances = str('')
for i in r.importances_mean.argsort()[::-1]:
    feature_importances += f"{df.columns[i]}: {r.importances_mean[i]:.3f} +/- {r.importances_std[i]:.3f} \n"
# Metric Logging: Custom Structure (Step 6)
aic_connection.set_custom_info(
    custom_info= [
        MetricCustomInfo(name= "Feature Importance (verbose)", value=  str(r)),
        MetricCustomInfo(name= "Feature Importance (brief)", value= feature_importances )
    ]
)
#
# Save model
import pickle
pickle.dump(clf, open(MODEL_PATH, 'wb'))
#
# Metric Logging: Tagging the execution (Step 7)
aic_connection.set_tags(
    tags= [
        MetricTag(name="Validation Method Used", value= "K-Fold"), # your custom name and value
        MetricTag(name="Metrics", value= "R2")
    ]
)

entry.title: Re: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales o...
entry.content:
Hi @omega-ou 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Japanese Yen does not have decimal places in SAP, so all calculations round to the nearest whole number. The calculation of tax such as 10% VAT may lead to fractional values, which SAP standardly rounds either up, down, or standard based on the system and tax code configuration. This sometimes causes discrepancies between the legally expected tax per Japanese tax requirements and the system calculated value.

I advice you consider doing the following:

  1. Tax rounding in SAP for Japanese scenarios can be controlled through specific routines and VAT code settings. In the SAP configuration, you can select rounding rules for each VAT code: standard (round to nearest), round up, or round down. These settings are typically found in the tax code using transaction OBYZ or VAT customization, depending on release and localization settings.
  2. Make sure you use routines like 16 and 17 (In case you want to discount condition type, you need to give Routine 16 in the Alt. Cal. Type and also add Routine 17 in your Pricing Procedure) to influence rounding, which is available in pricing procedure configuration (V/08). For JPY, the system should use these routines to match rounding at the whole yen.
  3. You can configure decimals for JPY in table TCURX or via transaction OY04 for currency decimals (For this go to T.Code oy04, select the currency JPY and maintain the required decimals there). For Japan, you should set the decimal to 0, and all values should be rounded by SAP accordingly.
  4. Finally, you do have the possibility to manually override the rule. If strict legal compliance is required and discrepancies persist, SAP typically expects the system settings to reflect required rounding. Manual tax adjustment lines or post-processing adjustments may be required for occasional exceptions, though note that this is less common and less automated.

Below reference provide further details.

Rounding control in system setting (table TCURX/OY04)

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP CPQ Subscription to Events - Testing with External Webhook Application
entry.content:
SAP CPQ supports subscription to events, allowing developers to react to changes in real-time. This blog explores how CPQ developers can leverage external webhook applications to test and validate these event subscriptions effectively.

 

What Are SAP CPQ Event Subscriptions?

SAP CPQ allows developers to subscribe to specific system events—such as quote creation, approval, or status changes. When these events occur, CPQ sends a payload to a designated webhook URL, enabling external systems to respond accordingly.

This is particularly useful for:

  • Triggering workflows in external systems (e.g., SAP BTP, CPI or Integration Suite, CRM, ERP, S4 HANA)
  • Logging and auditing activities
  • Real-time notifications and alerts
  • Data synchronization across platforms

Why Test with an External Webhook Application?

Before deploying event subscriptions in production environment, it's crucial to test the payloads, headers, and response handling. External webhook applications provide a sandbox environment to:

  • Inspect incoming requests
  • Validate payload structure
  • Simulate response codes
  • Debug integration issues

Popular tools include:

  • Webhook.site
  • RequestBin
  • Beeceptor

Step-by-Step: Testing SAP CPQ Event Subscription

1. Create a Webhook Endpoint

Use a tool like Webhook.site to generate a unique URL. This will act as your temporary endpoint to receive event payloads.

2. Configure Event Subscription in SAP CPQ

Navigate to:

CPQ Admin → Providers → Subscriptions to Events - Create
  • Choose the event (e.g., Quote Created)
  • Paste your webhook URL
  • Set headers if needed (e.g., Authorization tokens)

3. Trigger the Event

Perform the action in CPQ that should trigger the event (e.g., create a new quote).

4. Inspect the Payload

Go back to your webhook tool and inspect:

  • HTTP method (usually POST)
  • Headers (Content-Type, Authorization)
  • JSON payload (quote ID, user info, timestamp, etc.)

5. Validate and Iterate

Check if the payload matches your expectations. You can simulate different responses (e.g., 200 OK, 500 Internal Server Error) to test CPQ’s retry logic and error handling.

Best Practices

  • Use descriptive event names for clarity.
  • Secure your webhook endpoints with tokens or IP whitelisting.
  • Log all incoming requests for audit and debugging.
  • Implement retry logic in case of failed deliveries.

Real-World Use Case

Imagine a scenario where a quote approval in CPQ should trigger a Iflow in SAP BTP Process Automation. By subscribing to the "Quote Status Changed" event and sending the payload to a webhook that initiates the workflow, you create a seamless, automated process—without manual intervention.

SAP Standard Integration Package (SAP Event Mesh Strategy- Available for S/4 HANA Public Cloud & BRIM)

AMQP is the protocol used by the adapter to receive events from SAP CPQ, utilizing the updated SAP Event Mesh Webhook URL available in SAP standard integration packages.

Go to CPQ Admin Setup - Providers - Subscription to Events - Create Event (as shown below)

Final Thoughts

Event subscriptions in SAP CPQ open up a world of possibilities for real-time integrations. By testing with external webhook applications, developers can ensure their systems are robust, secure, and responsive. Whether you're building a simple notification system or a complex multi-platform workflow, this approach is a game-changer.

Glossary

  • AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol) is a messaging protocol, not an adapter itself.
  • The adapter (e.g., SAP Event Mesh or a middleware like SAP Integration Suite) uses AMQP to handle event-driven communication.
  • The Webhook URL is part of the configuration that allows SAP CPQ to send event data to SAP Event Mesh.
  • SAP standard packages refer to pre-configured integration content available in SAP Integration Suite or API Business Hub.

entry.title: Re: FM for inbound delivery creation
entry.content: @sudheerkumar_neerati The function modules BBP_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE_31I and BBP_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE are part of the SAP Business Warehouse (BW) component. They are intended for data replication and integration between the core SAP system and the BW system. They do not perform the same logistics execution tasks as standard LE transactions (VL31N) or BAPIs (BAPI_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE). Using them to create a delivery for a standard MM purchase order will result in errors, no action, or the creation of an incorrect object in the wrong system context

entry.title: Finding SAP Note using AI
entry.content:
The Challenge Every Basis Administrator Knows

If you’ve worked in SAP Basis, you know the scenario well:
A transport fails, a short dump appears in ST22, or a background job terminates.

The next step? Hunting through SAP Notes in the Launchpad.

This process is often:

  • Time-consuming, with hundreds of possible Notes.

  • Keyword-driven, meaning you need to guess the right search terms.

  • Trial-and-error, as many Notes don’t exactly match the error in your system.

The result is hours of lost productivity, delayed fixes, and frustrated teams.

Today’s SAP Notes search is powerful, but it depends heavily on manual filtering. Notes can be technical, fragmented, or reference outdated versions of components. Even experienced Basis administrators often spend too much time narrowing down the “right” Note.

At the same time, SAP landscapes are becoming more complex, spanning S/4HANA, cloud integrations, DB migrations, and hybrid infrastructures. This complexity only increases the challenge of quickly mapping system errors to the correct Note.

Where AI Can Make a Difference

This is where Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) can transform the way we work with SAP Notes.

Imagine a system that could:

  • Read your error log automatically (from ST22, SM21, STMS, or job logs).

  • Understand the context of the error beyond keywords (e.g., system version, module, DB type).

  • Recommend the top 3 SAP Notes most relevant to fixing that exact error.

  • Learn from history. If a Note solved the issue for your team in the past, it would prioritize that next time.

This would save Basis teams valuable hours, reduce downtime, and make troubleshooting far more efficient.

How It Could Work in Practice

  1. Log Capture: System errors, dumps, or transport logs are collected (e.g., via Solution Manager or Focused Run).

  2. AI/NLP Engine: An AI model trained on historical SAP error messages and Notes embeddings interprets the log text.

  3. Notes Recommendation: The system suggests a short, ranked list of relevant Notes.

  4. Feedback Loop: Administrators confirm whether the suggested Note fixed the issue, improving recommendations over time.

This approach transforms troubleshooting from manual search to AI-powered recommendation.

AI-powered Note recommendation is just the beginning. Over time, such a system could evolve into an intelligent assistant that:

  • Correlates SAP + OS + DB logs for cross-layer analysis.

  • Validates system refreshes and upgrades by comparing logs before and after.

  • Predicts risks in transports or background jobs before they fail.

This vision aligns with SAP’s own push toward intelligent operations and embedded AI, but with a strong focus on the Basis layer, where today much of the work is still manual.

Final Thoughts

By applying AI and NLP to SAP Notes, Basis teams can move from reactive troubleshooting to proactive, intelligent support.

This is an area where I believe there is huge potential for innovation, research, and where every Basis professional can benefit.

I’m exploring this further and would love to connect with others interested in AI + Basis.

entry.title: Re: Use of Settlement Material in SAP S/4HANA Condition Contract
entry.content:
Hi @drahul ,

great article. I agree that the use of the settlement material makes some things easier: Reduction of dependencies on material master data; different types of transactions / settlements can be easily distinguished ...

For most of my clients the material number of the underlying transaction is a very important characteristic in CO-PA, margin analysis, analytics and reporting. This includes the business processes that are covered by settlement management, like rebates, commissions ... In other cases conditions in the settlement contract are specific for a material.  Therefore it is many cases a must to use the material number as split criteria.

It is possible to combine both, settlement material and material number as split criteria. This requires that the settlement item is extended with a custom field "Material number of underlying transaction". For the material number this field is used as target field in the split criteria.

entry.title: Same code, different results. Obsolete Version in DSP cache?
entry.content:
After the last DSP Update from 19 August 2025 (which we got two weeks later), I had quite an issue with one measure showing different / incorrect result (the logic and sub-results were fine however).

Background: SAC story optimization, where I reduced the number of used models by merging several models into one, what reduced the connections / calls from SAC to DSP and thus reduced the fetching of data by 50+%. Basically, what I did was to take the original models and merged the model-views (FACT) into one model-view and on top I created new merged model. I replaced the original models in the story with the new one, validated all measures, authorizations... Approx. 30 measures were fine, but one was off. I did a deep dive, but could not find the issue. The original model had different result as my new one, even I used the same code (copy & paste).

After like half a day of desperate attempts to find the issue on my own, double checking with colleagues, ... I have decided to build from scratch.

Long story short: at the end, I have saved-as my new model-view to V2, saved-as my new model to V2 and replaced the model-view with the V2 copy. Result was matching now.

I would not believe myself, but I did repeat the process to V3, V4, ... and did have my approach 4-eyes checked.

Solution: The fix was to create new objects as copies. I guess some obsolete / corrupt version remained in the DSP cache. So, if anyone observes issues with data and is unable to find the root cause, try to copy the objects before deep-diving.

For the example you mentioned (copying SD order types versus FI document types), the behaviour is the same in both evaluation and implementation projects.

The difference is not related to project type but to SAP’s configuration governance in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Some objects, like FI document types, can be copied and adjusted by customers. Others, like SD order types, are locked by design to maintain standardisation across tenants.

So even if you shift from evaluation to implementation, you will not obtain extra flexibility in these areas. The available configuration options remain the same.

You can refer to the below useful SAP Documentations

SAP Help – Central Business Configuration

SAP Help – Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP S4/HANA Cloud Public J55 test script, realignment...
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

Apologies for the late reply, and thank you for reaching out to the SAP community

If your realignment run was successful but the Realignment Results, Profitability Analysis app shows No data found, here are a few points to check:

Selection Parameters
Ensure the ledger, company code, fiscal year, and realignment date used in the run are also entered in the Realignment Results app. If these do not match, no data will be displayed.

Realignment Criteria
Realignment affects only postings where profitability characteristics such as profit centre, product sold, or customer group were altered after the original postings. If there were no master data changes or no qualifying journal entries, the run completes, but no items appear in the results.

Job Log
Check the log of the realignment run in the Run Realignment app. It should show the number of items found and processed. If it displays 0 items processed, that explains why the result list is empty.

Scope / Restrictions
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, realignment is restricted to profitability analysis fields (defined in scope item J55 – Profitability Analysis). Attempting to realign on a field that is not supported will produce no results.

A successful run with no data typically indicates that no journal entries fulfilled the realignment criteria. Check the run log first, then verify whether you altered any profitability characteristics that should have triggered realignment.

Realignment Results - Profitability Analysis: App(F2549)

SAP Help – Realignment of Profitability Analysis Data (J55)

Feel free to reach out if you need further support

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Error CRToWords.DLL” and “Load report failed” during...
entry.content:
Dear All,

As a workaround, I have created a function in HANA Studio to convert the amount to words, and it is working fine.

CREATE FUNCTION ConvertNumberToWords (IN input_num BIGINT)
RETURNS output_str NVARCHAR(500)
LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT
SQL SECURITY INVOKER
AS
BEGIN
DECLARE words NVARCHAR(500) := '';
DECLARE tens_digit INT;
DECLARE units INT;

-- 0
IF :input_num = 0 THEN
words := 'Zero';

-- 1–9
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 1 AND 9 THEN
IF :input_num = 1 THEN words := 'One';
ELSEIF :input_num = 2 THEN words := 'Two';
ELSEIF :input_num = 3 THEN words := 'Three';
ELSEIF :input_num = 4 THEN words := 'Four';
ELSEIF :input_num = 5 THEN words := 'Five';
ELSEIF :input_num = 6 THEN words := 'Six';
ELSEIF :input_num = 7 THEN words := 'Seven';
ELSEIF :input_num = 8 THEN words := 'Eight';
ELSEIF :input_num = 9 THEN words := 'Nine';
END IF;

-- 10–19
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 10 AND 19 THEN
IF :input_num = 10 THEN words := 'Ten';
ELSEIF :input_num = 11 THEN words := 'Eleven';
ELSEIF :input_num = 12 THEN words := 'Twelve';
ELSEIF :input_num = 13 THEN words := 'Thirteen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 14 THEN words := 'Fourteen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 15 THEN words := 'Fifteen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 16 THEN words := 'Sixteen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 17 THEN words := 'Seventeen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 18 THEN words := 'Eighteen';
ELSEIF :input_num = 19 THEN words := 'Nineteen';
END IF;

-- 20–99
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 20 AND 99 THEN
tens_digit := FLOOR(:input_num / 10); -- 2..9
units := MOD(:input_num, 10); -- 0..9

IF :tens_digit = 2 THEN words := 'Twenty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 3 THEN words := 'Thirty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 4 THEN words := 'Forty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 5 THEN words := 'Fifty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 6 THEN words := 'Sixty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 7 THEN words := 'Seventy';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 8 THEN words := 'Eighty';
ELSEIF :tens_digit = 9 THEN words := 'Ninety';
END IF;

IF :units > 0 THEN
words := :words || ' ' || ConvertNumberToWords(:units);

END IF;

-- 100–999
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 100 AND 999 THEN
words := ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(FLOOR(:input_num / 100) AS BIGINT)) || ' hundred';
IF MOD(:input_num,100) > 0 THEN
words := :words || ' ' || ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(MOD(:input_num,100) AS BIGINT));
END IF;

-- Thousands
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 1000 AND 999999 THEN
words := ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(FLOOR(:input_num / 1000) AS BIGINT)) || ' Thousand';
IF MOD(:input_num,1000) > 0 THEN
words := :words || ' ' || ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(MOD(:input_num,1000) AS BIGINT));
END IF;

-- Millions
ELSEIF :input_num BETWEEN 1000000 AND 999999999 THEN
words := ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(FLOOR(:input_num / 1000000) AS BIGINT)) || ' Million';
IF MOD(:input_num,1000000) > 0 THEN
words := :words || ' ' || ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(MOD(:input_num,1000000) AS BIGINT));
END IF;

-- Billions+
ELSE
words := ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(FLOOR(:input_num / 1000000000) AS BIGINT)) || ' Billion';
IF MOD(:input_num,1000000000) > 0 THEN
words := :words || ' ' || ConvertNumberToWords(CAST(MOD(:input_num,1000000000) AS BIGINT));
END IF;
END IF;

output_str := words;
END;

---------------------------------AED--------------------------------------
ALTER FUNCTION AmountToWords (IN amount DECIMAL(18,2))
RETURNS output_str NVARCHAR(500)
LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT
SQL SECURITY INVOKER
AS
BEGIN
DECLARE words NVARCHAR(500) := '';
DECLARE dirhams INT;
DECLARE fils INT;
DECLARE dirham_words NVARCHAR(200);
DECLARE fils_words NVARCHAR(200);

-- Split Dirhams and Fils
dirhams := FLOOR(:amount);
fils := CAST(ROUND((:amount - :dirhams) * 100, 0) AS INT);

-- Convert Dirhams part
IF :dirhams > 0 THEN
dirham_words := ConvertNumberToWords(:dirhams) || ' Dirhams';
ELSE
dirham_words := 'Zero Dirhams';
END IF;

-- Convert Fils part if present
IF :fils > 0 THEN
fils_words := ConvertNumberToWords(:fils) || ' Fils Only';
words := :dirham_words || ' and ' || :fils_words;
ELSE
words := :dirham_words || ' Only';
END IF;

output_str := words;
END;

Regards,

Prince Ebi

entry.title: Re: Scope Item 5W2 and Intercompany Scope Items like 1WO
entry.content:
Hello @SebastianB 

Scope item 5W2 – Group Valuation in the Universal Journal cannot be used together with the classic intercompany scope items like 1P9, 2TS, 1HO, 1MX, 1WO, or 2F4 due to system restrictions.

The reason is that group valuation elimination logic functions only with the advanced intercompany processes, as elimination is initiated through the Value Chain Manager in the new intercompany setup. The older “classic” ICO flows do not support this trigger and therefore cannot be used together with 5W2.

If you intend to use 5W2, you need to scope the following prerequisites instead.:

  • 5D2 – Intercompany Sales (Advanced)
  • 5HP – Intercompany Stock Transfer (Advanced)

This ensures that group valuation postings and intercompany eliminations function correctly.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Enhance Abap CDS View I_EquipmentData
entry.content:
Hi,

long time ago.

First, do not enhance e.g. cds view i_equipmentdata directly, it will work but this will cause trouble during the next update.  

I created a CDS view "ZX_IEquipmentData" type "extension view".

...
extend view I_EquipmentData with ZX_IEquipmentData

association [0..1] to egers as _Egers on $projection.equipment = _Egers.equipment
{
_Egers.neededfield1,
_Egers.neededfield2 as AliasNeededfield2,
case  <>
else
<>
end as as AliasNeededfieldx
}

Then you can use the cds view as an odp datasource in BW and drop the 0EQUIPMENT_ATTR. 

Quite sure there are better approaches, but everybody can see they are not shared by the cool experts.

Br.,

Telli

entry.title: The Next Frontier in SAP Finance: AI-Driven Continuous Close and Predictive Compliance
entry.content:
In today’s finance landscape, CFOs and finance leaders are under constant pressure to deliver faster insights, ensure regulatory compliance, and optimize global operations. Traditional month-end close cycles are no longer sufficient in an era where investors, auditors, and boards expect real-time transparency.

This is where SAP S/4HANA Finance combined with Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) is reshaping the game.

From Periodic Close to Continuous Close

The Universal Journal (ACDOCA) and SAP Central Finance laid the foundation for harmonized reporting across multiple entities. Now, AI extends this further by automating:

  • Journal entry validation with anomaly detection, reducing manual interventions.

  • Predictive accruals and provisions, ensuring accuracy before close.

  • Intercompany reconciliation across 50+ ERP landscapes in near real-time.

Instead of “waiting for month-end,” finance leaders can run predictive financial statements on-demand.

AI-Powered Predictive Compliance

Compliance frameworks such as SOX, IFRS 17, and ESG reporting require more than accuracy – they demand foresight. SAP’s integration of AI with Group Reporting and Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) allows:

  • Continuous monitoring of transactions against regulatory benchmarks.

  • Automated generation of IFRS-compliant disclosures.

  • Early detection of compliance risks before audits.

This shift transforms compliance from a reactive exercise to a strategic advantage.

Real-World Applications

Forward-thinking enterprises are already seeing results:

  • A global energy company leveraged SAP Cash Application with AI to reduce unapplied cash by 70%.

  • A multinational FMCG firm integrated predictive accounting into S/4HANA, reducing close cycles from 5 days to 1 day.

  • Several Fortune 500 firms are piloting AI-driven ESG reporting inside SAP Finance, preparing for the SEC’s new climate disclosure rules.

Why This Matters for Finance Leaders

Finance is no longer about reporting the past – it’s about shaping the future. CFOs who harness AI-enabled SAP Finance are positioning themselves as:

  • Strategic advisors to the board.

  • Guardians of compliance and trust in a digital world.

  • Drivers of enterprise value creation through predictive insights.

Looking Ahead

The convergence of SAP S/4HANA Finance, AI/ML, and real-time compliance signals a new era: the AI-Driven Continuous Close. This isn’t just an IT upgrade – it’s a paradigm shift in financial leadership.

Finance professionals who embrace this shift today will be tomorrow’s industry trailblazers.

@sureshsadhuSAP #sureshsadhuSAP

 

 

#sureshsadhu #sap #USA #FICO

entry.title: Re: An application error occurred. Please try again later...
entry.content:
Hi @Anu32 

Hope you are doing well.

Community would not be the best place for handling Server Log Errors. When encountering server log errors such as this one, the optimal approach is to create a support ticket with SAP from your LAUNCHPAD. Please follow these steps for a smooth and efficient resolution process: 

Necessary Details for Support Ticket

  • System ID: Provide the identification for your system.  Please ensure the system given in the ticket is the one where the issue occurs.
  • Support Access: Ensure SAP support has the necessary access to assist you. 2088892 - How to Grant Support Access to SAP SuccessFactors Support Staff - SAP for Me
  • Error Details: Include a detailed description of the error message. "An application error occurred. Please try again later, or notify support (with the error information of errorID=31b52631-a796-4020-abf0-04d9d776d870, timestamp=2025-09-04T09:48:16.751+0000, and the version information from the current screen) if the issue keeps occurring." include an image if possible.
  • Steps to Replicate: Outline the steps to reproduce the error.

Additional Information

Guidance: Refer to the relevant article for comprehensive details on the information required. 2748769 - Best Practices For Opening and Updating SuccessFactors Support Cases - SAP for Me

Components: Make sure to create the ticket under the correct component, such as:

  • Onboarding
  • Employee Central
  • Etc.

By including these details, you will enable SAP support to address your issue more effectively.

I hope this helps.

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP Incentive Management for Real-time Incentive calculation
entry.content:
Integrating SAP Sales Cloud V2 with SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management creates a powerful solution for real-time incentive calculation and sales performance optimization. Here's a breakdown of how this integration works and the benefits it offers:

Integration Overview

The mashup between SAP Sales Cloud V2 and SAP SuccessFactors Incentive Management enables sales teams to:

  • View real-time incentive data directly within the Sales Cloud interface.
  • Access a unified dashboard showing opportunities, leads, commissions, and payouts.
  • Receive instant updates as deals progress, with incentive data refreshed in real time.
  • Gain actionable insights into how performance affects earnings and what actions can maximize incentives.

Key Benefits

  1. Real-Time Insights & Motivation

    • Sales reps can see their commissions and performance metrics instantly.
    • Features like commission estimates, leaderboards, and performance dashboards help boost motivation.

  2. Streamlined Dispute Resolution

    • One-click traceability allows quick resolution of compensation inquiries.
    • Reduces administrative overhead and keeps reps focused on selling.

  3. Optimized Incentive Plans

    • Use AI-driven recommendations to refine compensation strategies.
    • Identify opportunities for bonuses or accelerators to maximize ROI.

  4. Flexible Plan Design

    • Easily model and test complex incentive plans using drag-and-drop tools.
    • Roll out new promotions without heavy IT involvement

Implementation Highlights

  • Once integrated, users can navigate to Sales History → Opportunities in SAP Sales Cloud V2.
  • A new dashboard section appears showing incentives and payments.
  • The mashup is enabled via standard configuration steps provided by SAP.

Integration Flow Description

  1. SAP Sales Cloud V2

    • Opportunity is created and assigned to a Opportunity Owner (Sales Employee).
    • Opportunity data includes total revenue,opporuntiy date, product, and stage.

  2. Employee Sync

    • The Employee in Sales Cloud is synced with SuccessFactors via master data integration.
    • Employee is linked to a Position in Incentive Manager.

  3. SuccessFactors Incentive Management

    • The Position is mapped to an Incentive Plan.
    • Incentive Plan defines rules, rule elements including quotas, accelerators, and payout logic.

  4. Real-Time Calculation

    • As the Opportunity progresses, incentive calculations are triggered.
    • Sales reps can view estimated commissions, performance dashboards, and leaderboards directly in Sales Cloud.

  5. Feedback Loop

    • Incentive results are sent back to Sales Cloud for visibility.
    • Managers can adjust plans or resolve disputes using traceable data.

entry.title: Re: CDS View for Project Budet,Actual And Commitment in S...
entry.content:
Hello @Jagdish1 

You don’t need custom enhancements; simply use Project Availability Control (AVC). When assigning a WBS in PR/PO, AVC compares the consumable budget with commitments and actuals, and can either warn or block you to save. Just activate and assign an AVC profile to your projects. For tolerances and messages. Check SAP Learning-Understanding Availability Control and SAP Help Portal-Maintain Budget Availability Control Profile for Projects

Regarding CDS views: no single released CDS provides combined data for budget, commitment, and actual. Instead, use available analytics such as the Budget and Commitment /Actual Line Item Analyser, or construct a composite view from budget (planning/budget views), commitments, and Journal Entry Item ACDOCA actuals. SAP Help Portal-Budget and Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer SAP Community

Let me know if it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Labs São Leopoldo: Desde Paraguay Visitamos las instalaciones de SAP LABS
entry.content:
Nuestra aventura épica en SAP Labs São Leopoldo🚀
Spoiler alert: Fue increíble y queremos contarte todo

📅Todo empezó con un plan (y mucha emoción)

Imagínate esto: un email llega a tu bandeja de entrada y Matheus Souza te invita a conocer SAP Labs en Brasil para aprender sobre Inteligencia Artificial. ¿Tu respuesta? ¡SÍ, por favor! 🙋‍♂️
Así comenzó nuestra aventura. Meses de planificación, coordinación de agendas, documentos, rutas, hoteles... pero con una sonrisa en la cara porque sabíamos que esto iba a ser ÉPICO.

🏎15 horas de carretera = 15 horas de aventuras

¿Conoces esa sensación cuando estás tan emocionado por algo que hasta un viaje de 15 horas se siente como una aventura? Pues eso nos pasó.
Desde Ciudad del Este, Paraguay hasta São Leopoldo fueron 15 horas en carretera llenas de:

  • Conversaciones sobre IA (obvio)
  • Predicciones sobre lo que íbamos a aprender
  • Chistes internos del equipo
  • Muchas paradas para café ☕

 

Algunos Manejan, otros Duermen!

Parada técnica en Porto Alegre: Cultura + Diversión

Antes del entrenamiento intensivo, nos dimos una vuelta por Porto Alegre. ¡Qué ciudad más linda!

Lo mejor de todo: conocer la cultura local, probar comida brasileña auténtica, y preparar nuestras mentes para absorber todo el conocimiento que venía.

Algunos se olvidaron los lentes de Sol 😎

Paseo Obligatorio en Sao Leopoldo

Hasta participamos de Una maratón!



Primera vista de SAP Labs: "¿Esto es real?"

Llegar a SAP Labs fue como entrar a una película de ciencia ficción. Edificios modernos, tecnología por todos lados, y esa sensación de "aquí es donde nace el futuro". Nos recibieron con la sonrisa más cálida del mundo y pensamos: "Esto va a estar buenísimo"

 

Lunes y Martes: Modo aprendizaje ACTIVADO

Día 1: "¡Esto es el futuro!"

Lunes por la mañana. Café en mano. Energía al 100%. Ready para aprender.

Lo que vimos (y nos voló la cabeza):

  • Introdução a metodologia AI Journey
  • Business AI SAP 
  • Joule for consultant
  • Joule for developers
  • Hands on: Joule on SAP build code

Día 2: "Ok, ahora sí que estamos en otra liga"

Martes. Más café. Más energía. Listos para el siguiente level.

Round 2 de conocimiento: 

  • Discovery Center
  • SAP Business AI Use cases
  • AI no BTP
  • Hands on: RAG with Hana 

 

Me Toco rendir en el frente! 😂

🌃Las noches: Donde nacen las mejores conversaciones

Si pensabas que todo era trabajo, te equivocaste. Las noches en São Leopoldo fueron LEGENDARIAS.

El plan: Salir a cenar, conocer la ciudad, probar comida local.

 Conocimiento nivel PRO: Ahora hablamos de IA como expertos (bueno, casi)

 Inspiración desbloqueada: Volvimos con mil ideas para implementar en Kuaatec

 Conexiones humanas: Hicimos amigos que están a miles de kilómetros pero se sienten súper cerca

 Visión expandida: Entendimos que el futuro no es "algún día", es AHORA

 

¡Los esperamos en Paraguay!

Crecer junto a las personas es el mayor resultado de todos - y esto lo comprobamos en primera persona.

Brasil nos abrió sus puertas, nos enseñó, nos inspiró y nos hizo sentir como en casa. Ahora queremos devolver el favor.

¡Equipo SAP, los esperamos en Paraguay! 

Las puertas de Kuaatec siempre estarán abiertas para ustedes. ¡Vengan cuando quieran!


Gracias infinitas (en serio, INFINITAS)

entry.title: Embedding Native Android Crypto in SSAM: A QR-Code Security Story
entry.content:
Embedding Native AES-256 Encryption in SSAM with NativeScript

Introduction

As mobile developers working on SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM), we often encounter scenarios where field technicians must collaborate closely to complete maintenance work. One of the challenges in these environments is ensuring that cooperation is documented, validated, and secure—especially when multiple technicians interact with the same work order.

Recently, we explored a QR-Code-based workflow that makes collaboration and double-checks simple, fast, and reliable. The idea is straightforward:

  • User1 first generates a QR-Code that includes their personnel ID, a validity window (start/end date), and a stamp of their authorized scenarios. At this stage, no choice is made between cooperation or double-check — the QR-Code simply encodes what User1 is permitted to do.
  • Later, when User2 is performing a task in the field, they select whether the activity is a cooperation or a double-check inside SSAM on their Android or iOS phone or tablet. User2 then scans User1’s QR-Code.
  • If the scan occurs within the validity window and User1 is authorized for the chosen scenario, SSAM creates a confirmation in the SAP system tied to User1, including any comments embedded in the QR-Code. If the QR-Code is expired or the selected scenario is not authorized for User1, SSAM immediately returns an error message explaining the issue (for example: “QR-Code expired” or “Unauthorized scenario”).

This ensures that every confirmation is validated against both time and authorization, keeping the workflow secure, auditable, and resistant to tampering.

This is a perfect example of a workflow that is both human-friendly and security-critical. The data in the QR-Code must be protected from tampering or unauthorized reading, because it affects operational records and accountability.

Why Secure QR-Codes Matter

In enterprise field operations:

  • Unauthorized edits can create compliance and audit issues. For example, if someone were able to forge a QR-Code saying a work order was double-checked when it wasn’t, it could compromise safety and regulatory compliance.
  • Sensitive data exposure could reveal internal workflows or personnel assignments to outside parties. Even small leaks can have serious implications in regulated industries.
  • Trust between technicians depends on verifiable records. QR-Codes that are cryptographically secured ensure that cooperation and double-check events can be audited confidently.

This means the QR-Code must not only be readable by the app but also tamper-proof. AES-256 encryption provides that guarantee when implemented correctly.

The Magic of Native Code in NativeScript

NativeScript is a cross-platform framework that allows JavaScript developers to call native APIs directly on iOS and Android. This capability is more than just a performance trick—it opens the door to:

  • Using platform-proven cryptography directly, like javax.crypto on Android or CommonCrypto on iOS.
  • Avoiding complex JavaScript crypto implementations that are slower and error-prone.
  • Accessing system-level features without writing a full native module.

In SSAM, this is particularly powerful because:

  • Extensions often need high-performance logic for encryption, image processing, or offline data manipulation.
  • We can write one JavaScript method that bridges into Android and iOS, keeping the business logic shared but the platform calls native.
  • It keeps the app lightweight, avoids large third-party libraries, and gives us full control over cryptography and encoding.

Essentially, NativeScript allows us to write JavaScript that feels like native code, with all the power, security, and speed of the underlying platform.

👉In this post, we’ll focus on the Android implementation of AES-256 encryption. In a future blog, we’ll show the iOS version side-by-side, demonstrating how both can live under the same JavaScript class.

Illustrative AES-256 Android Library

To demonstrate this, we built a small, self-contained library that performs AES-256-CBC encryption and decryption using native Android APIs. This is not a production-ready library, but it clearly shows how you can leverage native crypto safely in a NativeScript environment.

import logger from '../Log/Logger';

export default class NativeCryptoLibraryAndroid {

    /**
     * Derive a 32-byte AES key from a password.
     * Uses SHA-256 to normalize any password length into a proper AES key size.
     */
    static generateKeyFromPassword(password) {
        const passwordBytes = new java.lang.String(password).getBytes('UTF-8');
        const md = java.security.MessageDigest.getInstance('SHA-256');
        return md.digest(passwordBytes); // returns a Java byte[]
    }

    /**
     * Convert a hex string into a Java byte array.
     * Needed for IV handling, since IVs are often stored/transmitted as hex.
     */
    static hexToBytes(hex) {
        const bytes = Array.create('byte', hex.length / 2);
        for (let i = 0; i < hex.length; i += 2) {
            bytes[i / 2] = java.lang.Byte.parseByte(hex.substr(i, 2), 16);
        }
        return bytes;
    }

    /**
     * Encrypt plaintext using AES-256-CBC.
     * - Derives key from password
     * - Uses provided IV (or default if none supplied)
     * - Returns Base64 so it can be safely embedded in a QR-Code
     */
    static encrypt(plainText, password, ivHex = '7361705F6369706865725F696E69745F') {
        try {
            const keyBytes = this.generateKeyFromPassword(password);
            const secretKey = new javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec(keyBytes, 'AES');

            const ivBytes = this.hexToBytes(ivHex);
            const ivSpec = new javax.crypto.spec.IvParameterSpec(ivBytes);

            const cipher = javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance('AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding');
            cipher.init(javax.crypto.Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, secretKey, ivSpec);

            const plainTextBytes = new java.lang.String(plainText).getBytes('UTF-8');
            const cipherTextBytes = cipher.doFinal(plainTextBytes);

            // Prepend IV to ciphertext so it can be reused during decryption
            const combined = new java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream();
            combined.write(ivBytes);
            combined.write(cipherTextBytes);

            // Base64 encode for QR-Code embedding
            return String(java.util.Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(combined.toByteArray()));
        } catch (e) {
            logger.error('Crypto', 'encrypt error: ' + e.message);
            return null;
        }
    }

    /**
     * Decrypt Base64 ciphertext back into UTF-8 string.
     * Assumes IV is stored in the first 16 bytes of the encrypted payload.
     */
    static decrypt(encryptedBase64, password) {
        try {
            const keyBytes = this.generateKeyFromPassword(password);
            const secretKey = new javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec(keyBytes, 'AES');

            const encryptedBytes = java.util.Base64.getDecoder().decode(encryptedBase64);

            // Extract IV (first 16 bytes) and ciphertext (remaining bytes)
            const ivBytes = java.util.Arrays.copyOfRange(encryptedBytes, 0, 16);
            const cipherTextBytes = java.util.Arrays.copyOfRange(encryptedBytes, 16, encryptedBytes.length);

            const cipher = javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance('AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding');
            const ivSpec = new javax.crypto.spec.IvParameterSpec(ivBytes);
            cipher.init(javax.crypto.Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, secretKey, ivSpec);

            const decryptedBytes = cipher.doFinal(cipherTextBytes);
            return new java.lang.String(decryptedBytes, 'UTF-8').toString();
        } catch (e) {
            logger.error('Crypto', 'decrypt error: ' + e.message);
            return null;
        }
    }
}

Testing the Library

Here’s a simple test wrapper that demonstrates end-to-end encryption and decryption:

import NativeCryptoLibraryAndroid from './NativeCryptoLibraryAndroid';

export default function AndroidCryptoTest() {
    const password = 'SecretPass123!';
    const message = 'Assistance + Überprüfung für Double-Check ✅';

    console.log('Original Payload: ' + message);

    // Encrypt payload for QR-Code embedding
    const encrypted = NativeCryptoLibraryAndroid.encrypt(message, password);
    console.log('Encrypted QR Payload: ' + encrypted);

    // Decrypt back after scanning
    const decrypted = NativeCryptoLibraryAndroid.decrypt(encrypted, password);
    console.log('Decrypted Payload: ' + decrypted);

    if (message === decrypted) {
        console.log('✅ Encryption/Decryption successful!');
    } else {
        console.warn('⚠️ Decrypted payload does not match original!');
    }
}

✅This test highlights:
- Native AES-256 encryption
- Full Unicode support (German umlauts, emojis, checkmarks)
- Round-trip safety: plaintext → encrypted QR-Code → decrypted confirmation

Why Hex and Base64 Matter

When working with global enterprise data:

  • Hex encoding ensures byte arrays (like SHA-256 hashes or IVs) can be safely represented as strings.
  • Base64 encoding allows binary ciphertext to be safely embedded in QR-Codes, which are strictly text-based.

Without proper encoding, QR-Codes could corrupt Unicode characters or fail to round-trip correctly across platforms.

Lessons Learned

  1. Security comes first: Encrypting QR-Code payloads prevents forgery and protects sensitive workflow data.
  2. Native beats JS for crypto: Using Android/iOS APIs ensures better performance, correctness, and maintainability.
  3. Cross-platform consistency: With careful IV, encoding, and padding handling, a QR-Code generated on one OS can be read on another.
  4. Unicode matters: Base64 ensures comments in any language—German, Chinese, Arabic, emojis—remain intact.
  5. NativeScript’s power: The ability to call native APIs directly is a huge advantage for any performance- or security-critical logic.

Closing Thoughts

This QR-Code feature is not just a convenience; it’s about secure collaboration in the field. By leveraging native cryptography in a NativeScript-based SSAM extension, we can deliver a solution that is fast, secure, and cross-platform, while keeping the JavaScript layer simple and readable.

The broader lesson? When facing performance-critical or sensitive operations, let native code do the heavy lifting. NativeScript gives us a unique bridge to do exactly that, blending the simplicity of JavaScript with the power of the underlying platform.

And stay tuned—our next blog will show the iOS implementation, so you can see the complete cross-platform picture in action.

entry.content:
The reason why you are unable to raise request 「Set up　Hyperscaler VPN Connection」is because you don't have the necessary authorization to do so.

In order to submit a service request for the 「Set up　Hyperscaler VPN Connection」template, an S-user must be authorized to Create Billable Service Requests at the customer number level.

Upon reviewing your S-user ID, I found that the required authorization was only assigned at the installation level. Typically, you would need to reach out to your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization reassigned.

For more detailed information on S-user authorizations required the Private Cloud Service Request application, please refer to KBA 2669783 - S-user authorizations required for the Private Cloud Service Request application - SAP for Me 

Should you have any inquiries or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Success Factors cloud systems
entry.content:
In the system list when I open a new incident, I can't see all the Success Factors systems, like for example joysonsaftyT1 (DIGITS) or joysonsaftyD (DIGITS)

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Success Factors cloud systems
entry.content:
Hi Cathal,

The issue arises because your S-user currently lacks the required authorization to create support cases for the cloud installation number 9094XXXX. As outlined in KBA 2193754, S-users must have the "Display Cloud Data" authorization at the SuccessFactors installation number level, in addition to standard case authorizations, to create support cases for SuccessFactors. 

Typically, you would need to reach out to your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization reassigned. For more detailed information on 'Display Cloud Data' authorization, please refer to the KBA 2598170 - What is the Display Cloud Data authorization? - SAP for Me

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us.

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support
